speaker: Outstanding Art Direction for a Series
text: Roy Christopher, Ron Olsen  * * *  ## Transcript {david langley}     _Act 1  Scene 1 - Frasier's Apartment  Fade in.  Niles is by the bookcase, Frasier comes from the kitchen with the placemats._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles?  Listen, when Claire gets here, can you give us a moment of privacy, please?
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Art Direction for a Series

speaker: Niles
text: Of course.

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, I'm planning on asking her to go to Belize with me next weekend.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Belize-imo!

speaker: Frasier
text: You'd better Belize it!

speaker: Niles
text: Let's see what we can do with "Ecuador."

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe later.

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, next weekend?  That's awfully soon, I hope Claire's free.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well actually Lana told me on the Q-T that Claire's already gotten wind of the trip, and she's eager to go. So all that's left for me to do is ask her and act surprised when she says "Yes."

speaker: Niles
text: Wow.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, are you jealous?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I might be jealous, but as it happens, I have plans next weekend myself.  You know Daphne and I are celebrating one year of being together.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, that's wonderful.  Gosh.  So, what do you have in store?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, a weekend alone at my apartment.  You see, we don't need beaches or sunsets, just a simple Victorian bathtub filled with champagne, us, and a non-slip mat.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's romantic and yet prudent.  Very good.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: Frasier
text: Here's where I'm taking Claire.  Do you think she'll like it?

speaker: Niles
text: Lush grounds, white sandy beaches, this hotel looks amazing, she's going to love it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, I also took the liberty of buying myself a new piece of luggage by Moritzio.  Would you care to see it?

speaker: Niles
text: Moritzio?!  Try and stop me!  I'm green with envy! _They rush off to Frasier's room.  Daphne comes back in and picks up the Belize brochure, looking though it with excitement.  The doorbell rings and she goes to answer it.  It is Claire._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, hello, Claire.

speaker: Claire
text: Hi, Daphne.  You seem so happy.  What?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well it seems Niles is going to surprise me with an exotic trip for our anniversary.

speaker: Claire
text: How funny.  You know, Frasier...

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm so excited.  We've only recently started going away together.  We wanted to wait until we got to know each other better.

speaker: Claire
text: Really?

speaker: Daphne
text: I know, it sounds old fashioned.  But there's nothing worse for a relationship than moving too fast.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Claire.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Claire
text: Oh, hi.

speaker: Daphne
text: I've just been telling Claire about our anniversary plans.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes!  There's no place like home.

speaker: Daphne
text: Right, home.  _They all chuckle, for different reasons.  Niles and Daphne head into the kitchen.  Claire sits on the couch._

speaker: Frasier
text: Claire, listen, uh, I know this is coming out of the blue, but how would you like to go away with me next weekend, to Belize?

speaker: Claire
text: That sounds wonderful, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sitting beside her_] I thought you might say that.

speaker: Claire
text: Only... do you think maybe it's too soon for us to go away together?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I, I don't know.  Do you?

speaker: Claire
text: I don't know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'd hate for us go away before we're ready.

speaker: Claire
text: So are you saying we're not ready?

speaker: Frasier
text: I... don't know.  Are you?

speaker: Claire
text: I don't know.  I just don't want to jeopardize our relationship.

speaker: Frasier
text: Would we be?

speaker: Claire
text: I don't know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if we don't know, maybe we should wait.

speaker: Claire
text: Okay, you know best. _Frasier looks confused and disappointed.  Reset to: - the kitchen. Daphne is preparing sandwiches._

speaker: Daphne
text: So Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: Mm-Hmm?

speaker: Daphne
text: About our anniversary weekend, I'm trying to figure out what to bring.  Will your apartment be warm that weekend, or unseasonably cold?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I keep the thermostat at a steady seventy-one, but I'm flexible within a degree or two.

speaker: Daphne
text: Will we snorkel?

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, you're making me blush.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Niles, stop it.  I know about the trip to Belize! I'm sorry, I overheard you talking to your brother. Trust you to plan something so romantic!

speaker: Niles
text: That isn't what...

speaker: Daphne
text: Stop the charade!  A bathtub full of champagne, please! We used to do that in high school!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, turns out I'm not going to Belize after all.  Claire thinks it may be too soon for us to go away together.  Or I do.  I forget who spoke last.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm so sorry.  You must be devastated.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well...

speaker: Niles
text: Can I have your reservations?

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I've decided to go away with Daphne for our anniversary.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why not?  At least one of us should have the most romantic weekend of his life.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you Frasier.  I only wish it could be you.  Do you suppose I could borrow your new luggage? [_off Frasier's look_] That's too far.  _Reset to: the living room. Claire steps out of the powder room._

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, it's official.  Niles is whisking me away next weekend. I'm so excited.  Each trip just gets better and better.

speaker: Claire
text: [_rising_] Because you waited.

speaker: Daphne
text: I suppose, but looking back I can't believe we held off for so long.  All the fun we missed.  Let's face it, when it's the right person, there's no sense in waiting. _Claire sits down at the table with a confused look.  Daphne heads off. Frasier comes in and hands Claire a bottle of water._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, here we are, Claire.

speaker: Claire
text: Thank you.  Frasier, about Belize...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sitting_] Now, now, Claire, we've made our decision and I think it's a good one.

speaker: Claire
text: Maybe it's not too soon to go away.

speaker: Frasier
text: Go on.

speaker: Claire
text: Are we possibly denying ourselves a wonderful trip?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, examining it from all angles, one could certainly make a case...

speaker: Claire
text: Let's go!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm already packed!

speaker: Claire
text: Oh, I better run!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] I thought we were having lunch.

speaker: Claire
text: Well, if we're going to Belize, I've got some shopping to do.

speaker: Frasier
text: What do you mean "if"?

speaker: Claire
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just go shop!

speaker: Claire
text: Ahh, bye!

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye-bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I'm sorry, it turns out Claire and I are going to Belize after all.  You and Daphne will have to go someplace else.

speaker: Niles
text: Wait!  Daphne has her heart set on Belize!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, this is not "Cranes Go Caribbean", I want to be alone with Claire!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Dad.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, guys.  Ariel, come and say hello to Frasier and Niles.

speaker: Roz
text: Say hello.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Roz
text: Say hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Roz
text: Say hello!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all right, Roz, that's enough, please.

speaker: Roz
text: Ariel just joined Martin's dog group at the park.

speaker: Martin
text: Eddie was his sponsor!

speaker: Roz
text: And Ariel discovered squirrels.  I discovered I'm not the only woman using my dog to meet men.  Apparently we also hunt in packs.  Come on, let's go get some water.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Frasier, I got a little favor to ask you.  Duke and I are going on a fishing trip next weekend, and I need you to look after Eddie.

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, I've got plans next weekend, Dad.  Where are you going?

speaker: Martin
text: Belize!  Yeah, I saw that brochure you had lyin' around. The fishing looks fantastic, not to mention the sandy beaches, the lush grounds...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Dad, I'm familiar with it.  That's where I'm taking Claire.

speaker: Niles
text: And I'm going with Daphne. [_Frasier glares at him._] Well, if he's goin', I'm goin'!

speaker: Martin
text: Great!

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell.  The more the merrier.   **GETTING THERE IS HALF THE FUN**  _Scene 2 - Lana's VW  Fade in.  Lana is driving Frasier to the airport._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, by the way, thanks for driving me and Claire to the airport.

speaker: Lana
text: Frasier, please, are you kidding?  Because of you, my Kirby got a "B" in history.  A "B."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it turned out well for both of us.  For once, somebody else got the grade and I got the girl.

speaker: Lana
text: God, I just hope Claire is waiting outside.  This traffic is terrible. _Lana honks her horn and swerves.  Frasier takes her cigarette and puffs on it._

speaker: Lana
text: I didn't know you smoked.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't.  The way you're driving I'm not gonna die of natural causes anyway.

speaker: Lana
text: Give me that.  Do you have a problem with my driving?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, it's fine.  Just wish you'd pick a lane, that's all.

speaker: Lana
text: Pick, pick, pick, pick, pick, pick.  Well, you're certainly an expert at that.

speaker: Frasier
text: What is that supposed to mean?

speaker: Lana
text: It means... that nothing is ever good enough for you. You complain about everything.

speaker: Frasier
text: That is not true!

speaker: Lana
text: Oh, come on, Frasier!  I have been out with you!  "The wine has turned."  "The silver has tarnished."  "The service is too slow."  "The cheese is runny."

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine, it was Camembert.  If anything, it wasn't runny enough. Yes, I may have exacting standards, but what you choose to characterize as fault-finding, I think of as my steadfast refusal to settle.

speaker: Lana
text: Please!  This Newport is more alive with pleasure than you are.  The truth is, Frasier, you don't know how to be happy.

speaker: Frasier
text: That is ridiculous.

speaker: Lana
text: Admit it.  You know I'm right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Want to see me happy?  You leave more than half a car length between us and that Taurus.  _Lana's eyes go wide in fear and she stomps on her brakes.  The car smashes into the Taurus and the hood flips up._

speaker: Frasier
text: At least whoever gets my seat on the plane will be happy. _FADE TO:  Scene 3 - The Hotel Lobby in Belize  Fade in.  Frasier is sitting at a table, the manager comes up._

speaker: Manager
text: Dr. Crane?  Dr. Crane?  I understand your room is not satisfactory?

speaker: Frasier
text: YES, I HAD A RESERVATION FOR AN OCEAN-VIEW SUITE AND INSTEAD I GOT A SINGLE ROOM OVERLOOKING AN ABANDONED BUS!

speaker: Manager
text: Please, sir, you don't have to yell.

speaker: Frasier
text: OH, I'M SORRY.  YOU SEE, MY EARS GOT CLOGGED SOMEWHERE ABOVE OAXACA AND THEY HAVEN'T POPPED YET!  NOW IF I COULD JUST GET THE ROOM THAT I RESERVED...

speaker: Manager
text: I'm afraid we gave your room away.  Check in time is three o'clock and we never heard from you.

speaker: Frasier
text: LET ME SEE... AT THREE O'CLOCK, MY GIRLFRIEND AND I HAD JUST DISEMBARKED IN PUNTA GORDA FROM OUR PLANE, THAT WAS LATE BECAUSE THE PILOT HAD TO DUST SOME CROPS.  I COULD HAVE CALLED DURING MY CONNECTING TRACTOR RIDE, BUT I HAD TO FIND OUT WHICH OF FOUR AIRLINES HAD LOST MY LUGGAGE, NOT TO MENTION... my ears just popped!

speaker: Manager
text: Congratulations, sir.

speaker: Frasier
text: I still want a better room!

speaker: Claire
text: FRASIER, THIS PLACE IS WONDERFUL!  YOU SHOULD SEE THE POOL!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's all right, my ears are better now.

speaker: Claire
text: Oh!  Well, that's good news.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, we're on a roll.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, look who's here.

speaker: Niles
text: Well hello there.  We thought you'd decided to hide in your hotel room all weekend.

speaker: Claire
text: Well, actually, we just got here, we missed our flight this morning.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh dear, what happened?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Lana happened.  We were on our way to the airport...

speaker: Claire
text: Frasier, please.  They don't need to hear the whole story and God knows I'm good for a while.

speaker: Niles
text: So, who's up for a drink?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yes, you've got to try a Belize Bomber.  Couple of those and you'll be flying.  Come on.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, plus every one you kill they put a decal on your coconut.

speaker: Frasier
text: You go ahead Claire, I'm still working on our room.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, this vacation is going to do you good.  This place is completely freeing.  Would you believe today I dabbled in public nudity?  Daphne and I found a secluded cove on the beach.  We shed our garments and surrendered ourselves to the sand, the sea and one rather curious grouper.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't you have a diary?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, look who finally got here!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Fras, how was your flight?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, don't poke the bear, Dad.  How was fishing?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Duke and I caught the biggest marlin you've ever seen. The swells were huge, it took us two hours to reel it in.

speaker: Niles
text: Where's Duke?

speaker: Martin
text: He's up in his room. Sunburned, heaving his guts out.  You guys oughta come out tomorrow.

speaker: Hostess
text: Sir?  Your table is ready.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, thanks.  Fras, why don't you and Claire join us?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no thanks Dad.  We've reserved a romantic table for two at the water's edge.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, say no more. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 4 - the dining room. Martin, Daphne and Niles are eating dinner._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I've gone on long enough about fishing.  What'd you guys do today?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you know, took a swim, got some sun.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, just make sure you keep your suits on.  The skipper of the fishing boat has a telephoto lens.  He posts the photos in the bait shop under "Catch of the Day."

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, look who decided to join us.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Martin
text: What happened to your table?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we waited an eternity for our table but it never opened up.

speaker: Claire
text: Frasier, this is fine.  Let's just turn our chairs around. Look, ocean view.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right.

speaker: Waiter
text: Would you like a menu?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you know what?  You have got to get the John Dory.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, it can't be any better than this halibut.

speaker: Martin
text: No, don't listen to 'em.  These soft-shelled crabs are meltin' in my mouth.

speaker: Waiter
text: I'm sorry, sir, but we're out of all three.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wonderful.  Well, what fish do you have?

speaker: Waiter
text: We make a decent swordfish.

speaker: Frasier
text: "Decent"?  That's what I traveled four thousand miles for? "Decent"?  You should put that on your menu: Home of the Decent...

speaker: Claire
text: I'll have the swordfish.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Swordfish is fine, thank you.

speaker: Claire
text: Frasier, what's the matter?

speaker: Frasier
text: Didn't you hear?  They're out of everything...

speaker: Claire
text: Frasier!  We've both had a long day, but we're here now, why can't you make the most of it?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry.  You know, you're right.  Okay, not another word.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, as long as everyone's here, I'd like to make a toast.

speaker: Frasier
text: All righty.

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, there's nothing gives me greater joy than to see both my boys happy.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mr. Crane, is something the matter.

speaker: Martin
text: AHH, it's reelin' that fish in today, my arms are shot.  I'll be all right.  Anyway, what I wanted to say was- AHHH!

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, don't be a hero.  Put down the coconut.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I just want to say that I'm not the only fisherman in the family.  In fact, I'm not even the best one.  One year ago, after seven years of trying to get her to bite, Niles finally hooked Daphne.  And I think we'd all agree that she's quite a catch.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thank you. _She lifts Martin's drink up so he can sip the straw.  The waiter comes back to whisper to Frasier._

speaker: Martin
text: And Claire, I just want you to know how glad we are that you're here.  I don't remember Frasier being this happy in a long time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Out of swordfish too?

speaker: Waiter
text: I'm sorry sir, may I suggest the pepper steak?

speaker: Frasier
text: Steak?  That's what we should eat at Belize's finest seafood restaurant?  There's an ocean full of fresh fish not fifteen feet away, but why not try a slab of artery-clogging, hormone- injected, frozen red meat instead?!?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry Dad.  Please continue.

speaker: Martin
text: No, that's all right, I'm done.

speaker: Claire
text: Actually, I think I am, too.  Excuse me.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] Oh, Claire.  Claire!

speaker: Martin
text: You didn't tell me you had steak here!  _The waiter adopts a very put-upon look.  FADE OUT.  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - Frasier's Hotel Room  Fade in.  Frasier comes into the room.  He notices Claire's suitcase laid open on the bed._

speaker: Frasier
text: Claire?

speaker: Claire
text: [_calling from the bathroom_] Yes?

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, uh...  I, I don't blame you for wanting to leave, but before you go, I, I'd just like to say that I'm really sorry for getting so upset.  You see, it's just that since I met you, I thought... I've thought you were pretty much perfect for me. And I guess I just wanted our first trip together to be perfect too.  I think it still can be.  What can I say to convince you to stay?

speaker: Frasier
text: I see I'm off to a pretty good start.

speaker: Claire
text: Frasier, I wasn't going to leave.  I'm crazy about you. I just started to feel like  you didn't want to be here with me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh, nothing could be further from the truth.

speaker: Claire
text: I mean, this weekend doesn't have to be perfect, let's just try to have fun.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fun?  Oh, I can do that.  Fun's been my nickname since math camp.

speaker: Claire
text: Math camp?  You're just trying to get me into bed.  _She pushes him to the bed and joins him.  DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 2 -- Later Frasier curls up next to Claire._

speaker: Frasier
text: I must say, this trip has certainly taken a turn for the better.  I'll tell you something else: I'm happy.  Utterly and completely happy. _He lays back and drifts off.  The woman next to him rolls over, it is now Lana._

speaker: Lana
text: I'm glad, Frasier.  I'm happy too.  _They kiss.  CUT TO: Claire shaking Frasier awake._

speaker: Claire
text: Frasier?  Frasier?  Frasier?  Are you okay?  You were talking in your sleep.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, I'm okay, I'm fine.  Go back to sleep.  _Claire turns back over.  Frasier caresses her shoulder to make sure she's asleep, then slips out of bed.  FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - The Hotel Lobby  Fade in.  Frasier is on the phone in his bathrobe._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, it's me, Frasier.  Listen, I'm aware of the time, it's just that... Well, you're the last person on Earth I thought I'd be calling but I had this dream and I had to talk to you about it. _CUT TO: a dark bedroom. A figure is on the phone.  As she speaks and turns on the light we see it is Lilith.  As the scene progresses, we cut back and forth between Lilith and Frasier._

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, God.  I suppose you expect me to be awake for this conversation, don't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, I'll be brief.  It's just that I'm on vacation with my girlfriend Claire, a woman who by all conventional standards is perfect for me, and yet I just had a vivid sexual dream about someone who differs from her entirely.

speaker: Lilith
text: A man?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not that different.

speaker: Lilith
text: Someone you've slept with?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes, but it didn't work out.  You see, I worshipped her for years, but then we had a parting of the ways because it turns out she was just unpleasant, confrontational, self- centered...

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier, if you're dreaming about me, just say it.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Lilith, it's not you.  It's a woman named Lana.

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, it seems like a textbook simple dream.  Why are you calling me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, because you know me better than anybody else, and you're a terrific psychiatrist.

speaker: Lilith
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: So what do you think?

speaker: Lilith
text: As a working hypothesis, I'd say you have the hots for Lana.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, you see.  maybe I'm not making myself clear.  You see, the woman irritates me to no end.  She's antagonistic and, and opinionated.  Critical...

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, so I see.  What you're saying is unlike most women you've dated, she challenges you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe so, that's not the point.  You see Claire _is_ perfect for me.

speaker: Lilith
text: All right.  Why does this dream about Lana upset you?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know.

speaker: Lilith
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith?  Do you think I know how to be happy?

speaker: Lilith
text: Of course you do.  You just like a challenge.  You've never been one to take the easy road.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it seems I've skidded right off the road this time and into a ditch.  A deep one.

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, you could try to throw it into reverse and spin your wheels for a while.  Or you could get out into the ditch and get a little dirty.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Lana's the ditch, right?

speaker: Lilith
text: It's your metaphor.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well I guess I've got some thinking to do.  Thanks for talking, Lilith.

speaker: Lilith
text: Any time.  I love you Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: I love you too.
